question_title: Will BA's market close price on 2026-02-13 be higher than its market close price on 2026-02-03?
summary: Boeing (BA) faces a 10-day comparison window with several positive catalysts: the Singapore Airshow running Feb 3-8 (Air Cambodia order announced, potential for more), strong Q4 earnings momentum, and bullish analyst consensus with raised price targets. However, much of this good news appears priced in (stock up 7.7% YTD), and short-term stock movements are dominated by random walk dynamics. The 777X engine seal issue adds minor uncertainty. Base rate for stocks rising over 8 trading days is ~52-53%, adjusted slightly upward given near-term catalysts. Final estimate: 55% probability that BA closes higher on Feb 13 than Feb 3.

factors.description: Singapore Airshow catalyst (Feb 3-8): Air Cambodia order announced, potential for more deals during the week
Strong Q4 2025 earnings beat: Revenue +57% YoY, cash flow doubled expectations, analyst upgrades to $275-295 targets
FAA lifted 737 MAX production caps - removes operational constraint and signals regulatory confidence
Good news largely priced in: Stock already up 7.7% YTD in 2026, marginal buyers already aware of catalysts
777X engine seal issue disclosed: Some uncertainty, though no immediate delivery impact expected
Short-term stock movements are highly stochastic: 8 trading days is dominated by random walk properties
